attachments.text:
Various people have expressed an interest in doing an <https://www.outreachy.org/|Outreachy> internship with the R project (by contacting the R Foundation board, or asking on R-Ladies Slack groups). A blocker has been the high <https://www.outreachy.org/mentor/#mentor|Mentor requirements> (5-10 hrs/week during 6 week application period, 5 hrs/week during 3 month internship) and the need to find at least 2 mentors that can commit to this (see <https://www.outreachy.org/mentor/#coordinator|Coordinator duties>).

However, I think we can make this work by co-mentoring projects (see <https://www.outreachy.org/mentor/mentor-faq/|FAQ>), with the primary mentor being an expert (R Core member/experienced contributor) that volunteers < 1 hour/week and the secondary mentor being someone that can commit to daily supervision. This worked quite well for <https://github.com/SaranjeetKaur|@SaranjeetKaur>'s documentation project, with myself and <https://github.com/lawremi|@lawremi> meeting with Saranjeet for 30 min each week and myself providing ad-hoc support/documentation review in between (not daily supervision, but similar principle).

Outreachy requires the community (R project in our case) to find $6500 to fund one intern, then we can apply to the general Outreachy fund for another intern. I can commit to regular supervision for one intern under my fellowship and hopefully could pair up with an R Core member/experienced contributor relevant to project. If we had a second intern funded by Outreachy, we could potential pay someone to regularly supervise that project (again pairing with a member of R Core/experienced contributor if additional expertise required). A suitable stipend might be $3000-$6000 for such a supervisor, bring the cost to $9500 - $12500 for two interns, which seems reasonable.

It would also be helpful to have <https://www.outreachy.org/mentor/#volunteer|volunteers> to help during the application phase.

Potential projects, building on our work so far:

• Triaging Bugs
• Translating messages in a language that is currently not well covered

Dates: we have just missed out on the current round, so we're now looking at applying in January 2022 for internships running May-August 2022 (or waiting till the round after if that works better for potential mentors).
attachments.title: <https://github.com/forwards/rcontribution/issues/15|#15 Outreachy internships>

attachments.text:
Raised by <https://github.com/lawremi|@lawremi> at last meeting: would be good to add value to Slack by highlighting bugs where help is wanted.

Liaise with people doing bug triage to push bugs in direction of the Slack - maybe new channel? <https://github.com/elinw|@elinw> did this recently on the #general channel.

Also <https://github.com/llrs|@llrs> plans to work on prototype Shiny app/dashboard that might help with this.

attachments.text:
Suggested by <https://github.com/mine-cetinkaya-rundel|@mine-cetinkaya-rundel> at last meeting: design student projects based on R Dev Guide.

Maybe overlaps with <https://github.com/forwards/rcontribution/issues/11|#11> ?
